qas.question: What was the name of the nomad tribes that hunted bison?
Along which river did they hunt bison?
The Chichimeca are the ancestors of what people?
The Jornado painted onto what surface?

context: During the 14th century in the northeastern part of the state nomad tribes by the name of <a0_0>Jornado<a0_0/> hunted bison along the <a1_0>Rio Grande<a1_0/>; they left numerous <a4_0>rock<a4_0/> paintings throughout the northeastern part of the state. When the Spanish explorers reached this area they found their descendants, Suma and Manso tribes. In the southern part of the state, in a region known as Aridoamerica, Chichimeca people survived by <a2_0>hunting, gathering, and farming<a2_0/> between AD 300 and 1300. The Chichimeca are the ancestors of the <a3_0>Tepehuan<a3_0/> people.
